Label: Narrative
Text: The MOVING reference member state of this VC (Value Chain) is CZECH REPUBLIC. The reference MOVING Card ID of this VC is VC 17 CZ. Animals are hunted by members of the hunters organization. The game meat was not available for mainstream consumers. The VC has recently opened to public by developing new marketing chanels. It is possible to by game meat online from the associations of hunters. They do not sell meat products but the hunted animals that consumers have to process on their own.   The reference mountain chain of this VC is Giant Mountains. The reference mountain landscape of this VC is LAU 1 Trutnov. LAU 1 - Trutnov is the largest district within the NUTS 3 Kralovehradecky. The landscape of the region is very diverse with large differences in altitude. Such landscape makes the region less favorable for agricultural activities. 43,2% of the region covers agricultural land. Approximately a half of the agricultural land is arable land (53%). There is also a high share of perennial grassland in the region (41,6%). Forest land covers 46,9% of the region and this is the highest share within the NUTS2. The region includes the highest mountains of the Czech Republic (Giant Mountains) with the highest peak 1602 meters above s.l. The area of the mountains inlcude the National Park (with 385 km2).   The size of the area (km2) is 1146.78. The minimum altimetry of the LAU (Local Administrative Unit) is 263. The maximum altimetry of the LAU is 1603. The total population (in thousand) is 117.978. The population density (Inhabitants/km2) in the LAU is 102.87. The population change rate of the LAU in the last 10 years (%) has been -1.84%. The overall regional population density (Inhabitants/km2) is 121.79. The regional population change rate in the last 10 years (%) has been 0.44%.   The average per capita income (EUR/year) [Province] is 10130.69. The total Gross Value Added (GVA) (EUR million/year) [Province] is 9173.35. The primary sector share of total GVA/year [Province] is 4.50%. The secondary sector share of total GVA/year [Province] is 40.50%. The tertiary sector share of total GVA/year [Province] is 55.10%. The per capita income (EUR/year) [Region] is 9762.62. The total Gross Value Added (GVA) (EUR million/year) [Region] is 23148.69. The primary sector share of total GVA/year [Region] is 3.29%. The secondary sector share of total GVA/year [Region] is 46.85%. The tertiary sector share of total GVA/year [Region] is 49.90%.   The total number of bed places (BPs) in tourist accommodations/year in the LAU (Local Administrative Unit) is 55419. The regional (Region) share of total BPs/year is 0.45%. The number of agricultural holdings in the LAU is 1759. The nearest settlement with population over 100000 (km) is 100. In this region protected areas are present.   The primary sector share of total employment/year [Province] is 5.41%. The secondary sector share of total employment/year [Province] is 39.27%. The tertiary sector share of total employment/year [Province] is 55.33%. The primary sector share of total employment/year [Region] is 3.80%. The secondary sector share of total employment/year [Region] is 59.94%. The tertiary sector share of total employment/year [Region] is 36.26%.   Mountain regions are home for wild animals that are hunted for meat. The VC utilizes the natural assets of the area - wild animals such as wild boar, deer, pheasant, hare. The animals are hunted members of the hunters associations and marketed to consumers.   The VC directly utilizes natural assets. It is a specific asset that can compete with meat products produced by conventional live stock farms.    VC is often in conflict with agricultural production. Proliferation of the wild animals results in damages on crops. The VC attempts to deliver products to mainstream consumers by developing new marketing chanels. One of the key challenges for the VC is to establish trust with consumers. Meat needs to be tested, consumers need to have knowledge how to process the meat, since it is a less known food product. Overall the type of challenge faced by this VC is Current. This VC is classified as Traditional.   The type of innovation of this VC (Value Chain) is unspecified. The innovation is related to the whole VC. The land use systems involved are Natural land. The local assets include Natural.   The VC is very likely to be present also in neighboring countries (Poland, Germany, Austria).
